Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CRAMP-18 (synthetic AMPs20, fragment of mCRAMP, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (52.94%) toCRAMP-1It corresponds to residues 11-28 of mCRAMP.Activity: CRAMP18 is active against E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 50 uM), S. typhimurium KCTC 1926 (MIC 12.5 uM), P. aeruginosa KCTC 1637 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. subtilis KCTC 1918 (MIC 50 uM), S. pyogenes KCTC 3096 (MIC 50 uM), S-aureus KCTC 1621 (MIC >50 uM), C. albicans (MIC 50 uM), A. fumigatus (MIC 100 uM).Toxicity: 0% hemolysis at 100 uM (not hemo.lytic).Structure: random coil in water, helical in 50% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Shin SY, Kang SW, Lee DG, Eom SH, Song WK, Kim JI. 2000
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2000 Sep 7;275(3):904-9. doi: 10.1006/bbrc.2000.3269.Pub-Med.
Literature Information.Title: CRAMP analogues having potent antibiotic activity against bacterial, fungal, and tumor cells without hemolytic activity.
